text:
Deleted scene from "Joker" destroyed popular fan theory
07 Nov 2019, 13:15 by Daria Gromova
But many character fans will only be happy about this.
In an interview with IndieWire, Todd Philips, director of the new Joker, commented on a fragment of an online script. It not only smashes the popular fan theory to smithereens, but also allows you to better understand the ending of the film.
Caution, then spoilers!
The scene in question was in the original script, but was not included in the film. In it, Sophie watched the Murray Franklin show with Arthur Fleck on TV at home. These shots were abandoned, because the director decided to show the scene completely through Arthur's eyes, and switching to another location would destroy the effect.
This refutes the popular theory that the whole story is a sick fantasy of Arthur Fleck, who has been in the Arkham hospital all this time. If Sophie saw him, then he definitely got on the Murray show - not the fact that the case ended in the murder of the presenter and anarchy on the streets of Gotham, but Fleck was certainly free.
Given that they initially wanted to show Arthur from the side, too, it can be assumed that he really came in a clown costume and make-up, and the evening show really ended with his monologue and the death of Murray.
Obviously, the scene also served as iron proof that Sophie was alive. Philips commented:
Of course, he did not kill her. As a screenwriter and director, I confirm this. My team and I considered this a peculiar litmus test, allowing the viewer to determine how Fleck is insane. Almost everyone with whom I discussed the film realized that she had survived - after all, Arthur avenged only those who did him harm, and Sophie did nothing wrong. Although he is a villain, he also has principles.
Earlier, Philips has already confirmed that he is not going to release a directorial version, or publish something from material that was not included in the final editing.
